head.title: Political Briefing; Democrats Gain Hope In Pennsylvania Race

abstract.p: Pennsylvania poll shows Rep Ron Klink gaining in his effort to unseat Sen Rick Santorum, freshman Republican (S)

Democrats are taking heart from a Pennsylvania poll that shows Representative Ron Klink gaining in his effort to unseat Senator Rick Santorum, a freshman Republican.
At the start of the campaign, Democrats looking to regain control of the Senate viewed Mr. Santorum as one of the most vulnerable Republicans.

But Mr. Santorum proved to be a formidable raiser of campaign cash, and poll after poll showed him with a lead of 10 points or more over Mr. Klink. Democratic hopes began to slump, particularly when Mr. Klink proved a poor fund-raiser.
Then came the poll released on Tuesday by the Knight Ridder news service and Wayne State University. It indicated Mr. Klink had closed the gap to four percentage points.

Not only that, Mr. Santorum all of a sudden was pleading campaign poverty.Within hours, Mr. Klink was on the air with a television blitz. How? The Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee had finally come through with an $800,000 infusion.
